links.title: TSMC on Track to Start 3nm Chip Production in Second Half of This Year
links.description: Apple chipmaking partner TSMC says it will be ready to move its 3nm chip process to volume production in the second half of this year, putting it on track to supply Apple with the next-generation technology in 2023 (via ).

California port chief warns China lockdowns are ‘concerning’ for global supply chain

China’s zero-COVID policy will ‘definitely’ have an impact on the supply chain, Port of Long Beach director says
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.foxbusiness.com/economy/california-port-chief-warns-china-lockdowns-concerning-for-global-supply-chain.amp

links.title: California port chief warns China lockdowns are 'concerning' for global supply chain
links.description: China's weeks-long COVID-19 lockdowns are posing a risk to the global supply chain, one West Coast port director warned on " Mornings with Maria" Thursday. "We're almost about one month, or four weeks, of those lockdowns in Shenzhen and Shanghai; it hasn't really affected the ports," Cordero told FOX Business' Maria Bartiromo.

message.body:
$SPY “We are persistently seeing investors worldwide under-invested, not over-invested, in long-term assets, and the best source of long-term assets are equities and many asset categories in the private area.” Larry Fink, Chairman and CEO of BlackRock 
https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/14/blackrocks-fink-stocks-to-rally-in-2021-but-not-as-much-as-last-year.html

links.title: CEO of world's largest money manager sees stocks rallying in 2021 but not as much as last year
links.description: BlackRock' s Larry Fink told CNBC on Thursday he believes the stock market has room to run, but the head of the world's largest asset manager cautioned that the rally may not be as robust as it was in the second half of 2020.
